metadata.title: CVE-2024-27397 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: use timestamp to check for set element timeout Add atimestamp field at the beginning of the transaction, store it in thenftables per-netns area. Update set backend .insert, .deactivate and syncgc path to use the timestamp, this avoids that an element expires whilecontrol plane transaction is still unfinished. .lookup and .update, whichare used from packet path, still use the current time to check if theelement has expired. And .get path and dump also since this runs locklessunder rcu read size lock. Then, there is async gc which also needs to checkthe current time since it runs asynchronously from a workqueue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-261-generic - 4.4.0-261.295
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-261-generic - 4.4.0-261.295
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-261-lowlatency - 4.4.0-261.295
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-231-generic - 4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-231-generic - 4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-231-lowlatency - 4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-kvm - 4.4.0-1139.149
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1175-aws - 4.15.0-1175.188~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1183-azure - 4.15.0-1183.198~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-fips - 4.4.0-1107.114
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1107-fips - 4.4.0-1107.114
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1107-fips - 4.4.0-1107.114
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1107-fips - 4.4.0-1107.114
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-gcp - 4.15.0-1168.185~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-261.295').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.149').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1176.191').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1175.188~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1183.198~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.114').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.185~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1137.148~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
